overview:
Adam Wolfberg, MD, is a physician, entrepreneur, and writer living in Boston.

Adam is an obstetrician specializing in maternal-fetal medicine with Boston MFM. His clinical interests include prenatal diagnosis, fetal ultrasound, and preterm labor.

Adam is a founder and chief medical officer of Mindchild Medical, a startup medical device company commercializing non-invasive fetal EKG technology. He is also a founder and principal of Bellybaloo, a startup that makes fetal ultrasound images available to women to share online with their friends and family.

Adam’s first book, Fragile Beginnings, was published in February 2012. He has written on health-related topics for Slate.com, WSJ.com, Newsweek, the Boston Globe Magazine, and other publications. He blogs for the Huffington Post.
